channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Allow full business operations to save economy, governmet urged
item.author: Louella Desiderio
item.description: The Philippine Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the country’s largest business organization, has urged the government to allow businesses to resume full operations and let the economy recover from the impact of the COVID-19 crisis.

item.title: Government defending Philippines sovereignty in West Philippine Sea— Lorenzana
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana reassured the public yesterday that the Philippine government under President Duterte is actively and continuously defending the country’s territory and national sovereignty in the West Philippine Sea.

item.title: Private hospitals’ COVID-19 bed capacity allocation cut to 20%
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: he Department of Health is now requiring private hospitals to allocate 20 percent of their bed capacity for coronavirus patients, an official said yesterday.

item.title: Locsin: ABS-CBN takeover trespassing, theft
item.author: Pia Lee Brago
item.description: Trespassers at the ABS-CBN compound in Quezon City could be “shot” under the law as the act of taking over the network’s property and equipment is “trespassing” and “theft,” Foreign Affairs Secretary Teodoro Locsin Jr. warned yesterday.

item.title: Face-to-face class in Metro Manila difficult – Briones
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Even with a policy allowing limited face-to-face classes starting January, Education Secretary Leonor Briones believes this would be difficult to implement in schools in Metro Manila due to the current general community quarantine.

item.title: SONA: Duterte to unveil COVID-19 recovery map
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: President Duterte is expected to unveil a pandemic recovery roadmap during his fifth State of the Nation Address (SONA), Malacañang said yesterday.

item.title: Carpio, Morales file 11th case vs terror law
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Retired Supreme Court senior associate justice Antonio Carpio and former ombudsman Conchita Carpio-Morales have joined the petitioners against the Anti-Terrorism Act of 2020, electronically filing the 11th case against the ATA before the SC yesterday.

item.title: DILG seeks clarification on arrest of quarantine violators
item.author: Romina Cabrera
item.description: The Department of the Interior and Local Government is seeking clarification from Malacañang on President Duterte’s directive to arrest health protocol violators amid the congestion in jail facilities nationwide.

item.title: DOJ: 476 inmates died in first half of 2020 Senators want BuCor chief out
item.author: Evelyn Macairan
item.description: Since the start of the year, an average of two inmates have died daily in prison facilities nationwide under the Bureau of Corrections, for a total of 476 fatalities as of July 19, Justice Secretary Menardo Guevarra said yesterday.

item.title: Librarians correct unlicensed head of National Library on claim library science not taught in provinces
item.author: Rosette Adel
item.description: An official of Professional Regulatory Board for Librarians pointed out Wednesday that there are more than 70 library schools nationwide after the head of the National Library of the Philippines wrongly claimed librarianship courses are not offered outside Metro Manila.
